Detailed Description

Extension of InetAddress, with different conventions for name lookup. This makes handling null values in the configuration file easier. We need this different convention because we sometimes send an IP address to the other side, and "127.0.0.1" needs to be converted to the actual IP address of the machine.

XXX This ought to be subclass of InetAddress, but unfortunately that is a "final" class in JDKs before 1.4, so we do it as a delegation class (and a bit of other pain).

Version:
Id
ExtendedInetAddress.java,v 1.4 2005/01/30 15:13:43 ilyad Exp

com::xacct::CRANE::collector::ExtendedInetAddress::ExtendedInetAddress (  String  host  )  throws UnknownHostException [inline]
 

Create from a host-name string. For defaulting: use localHost rather than 127.0.0.1 wherever possible (null, "", 0.0.0.0, 127.0.0.1)

Parameters:
string host The specified host with null, "", or "0.0.0.0", or "127.0.0.1" being used for the local host. The string is trimmed of blanks before being used.
Exceptions:
UnknownHostException If a local address is passed in and local host lookup fails. 
00056                                                                         {
00057         String trimmedHost = CollectorUtil.nonNull(host);
00058         if (trimmedHost.length() == 0) { host = null; } // getByName wants this
00059         this.self = InetAddress.getByName(trimmedHost); // local host if trimmedHost == null
00060         fixAddress();
00061     }

Compare two InetAddress's for sorting purposes. Just like first.compareTo(second), if InetAddress supported compareTo()

Parameters:
other The other address.
Returns:
Negative, zero, positive integer according to wither this < = > other.
See also:
Comparable#compareTo 
00122                                             {
00123         if (self == other) { return 0; }
00124         if (self == null && other == null) { return 0; }
00125         if (self == null) { return -1; }
00126         if (other == null) { return 1; }
00127         // from here, we're guaranteed that self != null && other != null
00128         byte [] sbThis = self.getAddress();
00129         byte [] sbOther = other.getAddress();
00130         int result = 0;
00131         for (int i = 0; i < sbThis.length && i < sbOther.length && result == 0; i++) {
00132             result = sbThis[i] - sbOther[i];
00133         }
00134         if (result == 0) {
00135             result = sbThis.length - sbOther.length;
00136         }
00137         return result;
00138     }

void com::xacct::CRANE::collector::ExtendedInetAddress::fixAddress (   )  throws UnknownHostException [inline, protected]
 

If the address refers to something local (e.g., 127.0.0.1), try to change it to the host address. This should not be relied on 100% because of indeterminism with multi-homed machines. 

00068                                                             {
00069         byte [] addr = this.self.getAddress();
00070         // Check for magic addresses: 0.0.0.0, 127.0.0.1
00071         // XXX With JDK 1.4, use isLoopbackAddress()
00072         //   ... also look at isAnyLocalAddress(), isLinkLocalAddress(),
00073         //       isSiteLocalAddress().
00074         if (addr.length == 4 &&
00075             (addrEq(addr, 0, 0, 0, 0) ||
00076              addrEq(addr, 127, 0, 0, 1))) {
00077             this.self = InetAddress.getLocalHost();
00078         }
00079     }
